prompt.clinicalNote: **Summary:**- Female, 30 years old, BMI 38, weight 100 kg.- Presenting with heavy menstrual bleeding and pelvic pain.- History of one uneventful pregnancy, hypertension, and no known drug allergies.**Assessment and Advice:**Mrs. Smith, a 30-year-old female teacher with a BMI of 38, presents with heavy menstrual bleeding and worsening pelvic pain over the past few weeks. Examination findings reveal a palpable uterine mass and left-sided pelvic tenderness, suggestive of a uterine fibroid. Further imaging with ultrasound is recommended to confirm the diagnosis. Treatment options, including medication and surgical intervention, will be discussed based on the fibroid's size and location. Blood pressure management will also be reviewed to optimize care.**Plan:**1. Perform an ultrasound to confirm the diagnosis of a uterine fibroid.2. Discuss treatment options based on imaging results.3. Review and optimize blood pressure management.4. Provide ongoing support and address any questions or concerns.
guidelines: Heavy menstrual bleeding and pelvic pain.
prompt.prompt: You are provided with the text of a clinical note from a patient encounter and a set of clinical guidelines. Your task is to: 1. Cross-check the clinical note against each provided guideline: 2. Identify areas in the clinical note that do not fully adhere to the guideline recommendations. 3. Note any parts of the note that could be improved based on the guidelines. Include the full text of each guideline in your response: 4. For every guideline you reference, include its complete text. 5. Next to each suggested change, provide a short reference to the guideline (e.g., the guideline's name or identifier). 6. Return the clinical note as HTML-formatted code: The clinical note should be output as valid HTML. Any text in the clinical note that has been adjusted or needs adjustment (in light of the guidelines) should be wrapped in tags (to display in italics). Ensure that the guideline reference appears immediately following the italicized adjustment for clarity. Your final output should therefore contain: The complete text of each guideline used, with clear references. The HTML-formatted clinical note where adjustments appear in italics with the respective guideline reference. For example, in the following clinical note text: Summary: Patient presents with irregular menstrual cycles, intense cramps, and heavier flow, raising concerns for underlying conditions. Body: Patient reports irregular menstrual cycles, increased cramps, and heavier flow. No history of ovarian cysts or endometriosis. Further investigation with pelvic exam and imaging studies is warranted. Perform pelvic exam to assess reproductive organs. Consider imaging studies for detailed evaluation. Discuss family planning goals and contraceptive needs. Collaborate to determine the most appropriate management approach. An adjustement in light of this guideline (Endometriosis: diagnosis and management NICE guideline - https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/ng73) would be to this sentence Further investigation with pelvic exam and imaging studies is warranted. A family history of endometriosis would make the diagnosis more likely (Endometriosis: diagnosis and management NICE guideline) Here is the note text: **Summary:**- Female, 30 years old, BMI 38, weight 100 kg.- Presenting with heavy menstrual bleeding and pelvic pain.- History of one uneventful pregnancy, hypertension, and no known drug allergies.**Assessment and Advice:**Mrs. Smith, a 30-year-old female teacher with a BMI of 38, presents with heavy menstrual bleeding and worsening pelvic pain over the past few weeks. Examination findings reveal a palpable uterine mass and left-sided pelvic tenderness, suggestive of a uterine fibroid. Further imaging with ultrasound is recommended to confirm the diagnosis. Treatment options, including medication and surgical intervention, will be discussed based on the fibroid's size and location. Blood pressure management will also be reviewed to optimize care.**Plan:**1. Perform an ultrasound to confirm the diagnosis of a uterine fibroid.2. Discuss treatment options based on imaging results.3. Review and optimize blood pressure management.4. Provide ongoing support and address any questions or concerns. Here is each guideline with the title followed by the guideline: Heavy menstrual bleeding and pelvic pain. Possible uterine fibroid causing symptoms. Hypertension management optimization.
